known as lenus law the first one is about the fact that they often tend to encrypt their firmware or hide the
hardcoded secrets uh thinking that nobody will will be able to discover them and you don't need to secure those
things and the latter principle is about the open source components that they integrate as a part of their firmware or
soft software packages and uh it's it's a common uh belief that if many other
people are looking in those reporting vulnerabilities all the manufacturers have to do is to follow the uh the
disclosures and just update regularly and if there are no vulnerabilities found by other people there's
